episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including the surprising taste difference between croissant shapes, the role of a menstrual cycle coach in women's football, the coincidental names of archaeologists involved in the discovery of King Richard III's remains, and the unique behavior of the sarcastic fringe-head fish.

facts.fact: Croissant shaped croissants taste worse than non-croissant shaped croissants.
Manchester City women's football team has a menstrual cycle coach.
Two of the leading archaeologists to dig up King Richard III's bones were called King and Richard.
To establish dominance, the sarcastic fringe-head fish will engage in kissing competitions with rival males.
